definitions.text: the property of sound that varies with variation in the frequency of vibration
(baseball) the act of throwing a baseball by a pitcher to a batter
a vendor's position (especially on the sidewalk)
examples: he was employed to see that his paper's news pitches were not trespassed upon by rival vendors

definitions.text: promotion by means of an argument and demonstration
degree of deviation from a horizontal plane
examples: the roof had a steep pitch

definitions.text: any of various dark heavy viscid substances obtained as a residue
a high approach shot in golf
an all-fours game in which the first card led is a trump
abrupt up-and-down motion (as caused by a ship or other conveyance)
examples: the pitching and tossing was quite exciting

definitions.text: the action or manner of throwing something
examples: his pitch fell short and his hat landed on the floor

definitions.text: throw or toss with a light motion
move abruptly
examples: The ship suddenly lurched to the left

definitions.text: fall or plunge forward
examples: She pitched over the railing of the balcony

definitions.text: set to a certain pitch
examples: He pitched his voice very low

definitions.text: sell or offer for sale from place to place
be at an angle
heel over
erect and fasten
throw or hurl from the mound to the batter, as in baseball
hit (a golf ball) in a high arc with a backspin
lead (a card) and establish the trump suit
set the level or character of
examples: She pitched her speech to the teenagers in the audience
